subtitle: chapter 40 I returned to India
gratefully I was inhaling the Blessed
air Linea our boat Raj Putin I docked on
August 22nd 1935 in the huge harbour of
Bombay even this my first day off the
ship was a foretaste of the year ahead
12 months of ceaseless activity friends
had gathered to dock with garlands
ingredients soon at our suite in the Taj
Mahal hotel there was a stream of
reporters and photographers Bombay was a
city new to me I found it energetically
modern with many innovations from the
West
palms lined the spacious boulevards
magnificent state structures vie for
interest with ancient temples very
little time was given to sightseeing
however I was impatient eager to see my
beloved guru and other dear ones
consigning the four to a baggage car our
party was soon speeding eastward by
train toward Calcutta our arrival at
Howard station found such an immense
crowd assembled to greet us that for a
while we were unable to dismount from
the Train the young maharaja of kazama
bazaar and my brother Bishnu headed the
reception committee i was unprepared for
the warmth and magnitude of our welcome
preceded by a line of automobiles and
motorcycles and amidst the joyous sound
of drums and conch shells miss blessed
mr. right and myself flower garland from
head to foot drove slowly to my father's
home my aged parent embraced me as one
returning from the dead long we gazed on
each other speechless with joy
brothers and sisters uncles aunts and
cousins students and friends of years
long past were grouped around me not a
dry eye among us passed now into the
archives of memory the scene of loving
reunion vividly endures unforgettable in
my heart as for my meeting with shriyak
- wha words fail me
let the following description for my
secretary suffice today filled with
highest anticipation I drove Yogananda G
from Calcutta to Serampore
mr. right recorded in his trial
we passed by quaint shops one of them
the favorite eating haunt of Yogananda G
during his college days and finally
entered a narrow wall lane a sudden left
turn and there before his towered is
simple but inspiring two-story ashram
its spanish-style balcony jutting from
the upper floor the pervasive impression
was that of a peaceful solitude in grave
humility I walked behind
Yogananda G into the courtyard within
the hermitage walls hearts beating fast
we proceeded up some old cement steps
trod no doubt by myriads of
truth-seekers the tension grew keener
and keener has on leased road before us
near the head of the stairs quietly
appeared the great one
Swami Sri Yukteswar J standing in the
noble pose of a sage my heart heaved and
swell as I felt myself blessed by the
privilege of being the sublime presence
tears blurred my eager site when yoga
nun 2g dropped to his knees and with
bowed head offered his Souls gratitude
and greeting touching with his hands his
gurus feet and then in humble obeisance
his own head he rose that and was
embraced on both sides of the bosom by
shriyak - wha J no words pass at the
beginning but the most intense feelin
was expressed the mute phrase of the
soul how their eyes sparkled and were
fired with the warmth of renewed soul
Union a tender vibration surged to the
quiet patio and even the Sun eluded the
clouds to add a sudden blaze of glory on
bended knee before the master I gave my
own unexpected love and thanks touching
his feet calloused by time and service
and receiving his blessing I stood then
and face to beautiful deep eyes
smouldering of introspection yet raiding
with joy we entered his sitting room
whose whole side opened to the outer
balcony first seen from the street the
master braced himself against the worn
Davenport sitting in a covered mattress
on a cement floor
Yogananda G and I sat near the Guru's
feet with orange colored pillows
lean against and ease are positioned on
the straw mat I tried and tried to
penetrate the Bengali conversation
between the two Swami J's for English I
discovered is null and void when they
are together all those Swami ji maharaj
as the great guru is called by others
can and often does speak it but I
perceived the saintliness of the great
one through his heartwarming smile and
twinkling eyes one quality easily
discernible in his merry serious
conversation is a decided positive
lesson statement the mark of a wise man
who knows he knows because he knows God
his great wisdom strength of purpose and
determination are apparent in every way
studying him reverently from time to
time I noted that he is of large
athletic stature hardened by the trials
and sacrifice of renunciation his poise
majestic a decidedly sloping forehead as
if seeking the heavens dominates his
divine countenance he is a rather large
and homely nose which which he amused
themselves in idle moments flipping and
wriggling it with his fingers like a
child his powerful dark eyes are haloed
by an ethereal blue ring his hair parted
in the middle begins as silver and
changes to streaks of silvery gold and
silver II black ending in ringlets on
his shoulder his beard and moustache are
scant or thinned out it seemed to
enhance his features and like his
character are deep and light at the same
time he has a jovial and rollicking
laugh which comes from deep in his chest
causing him to shake and quiver
throughout his body very cheerful and
sincere his face and stature are strike
in their power as are his muscular
fingers he moves the dignified tread and
direct posture he was clad simply in the
common dhoti and shirt
both once died a strong ochre color but
now a faded orange glancing about I
observed that as rather dilapidated room
suggested the owners non-attachment the
material comfort the weather stained
white walls of the long chamber
we're streaked with fading blue plaster
at one end of the room hung a picture of
Larry mascha garland and simple devotion
there was also an old pictures showing
yogin energy as he arrived in Boston
standing with the other delegates the
Congress of Religion I noted a quaint
concurrence of modernity and an equation
a huge cut glass candle light chandelier
was covered with cobwebs through disuse
and on the wall was a bright up-to-date
calendar the whole room emanated a
fragrance of peace and calmness beyond
the balcony I could see coconut trees
towering over the Hermitage and silent
protection it is interesting to observe
that the master was merely to clasp his
hands together and before finishing he
is served or attended by some small
disciple incidentally I am much
attracted to one of them a thin lad
named paratha with long black hair to
his shoulder a most penetrating pair of
sparkling black eyes and a heavenly
smile his eyes twinkle as the corner of
his mouth Rises like the star and a
crescent moon appearing at Twilight
Swami Sri Yukteswar as joy is obviously
intense at the return of his product and
he seems to be somewhat inquisitive
about the products product however
predominance of the wisdom aspect and
the great one's nature hinders his
outward expression of feeling Yogananda
G presented himself with some gifts as
in the custom of the disciple returns to
his guru we sat down later to a simple
but well-cooked meal all the dishes were
vegetable and rice combinations Sri
Yukteswar ji was pleased at my use of a
number of Indian customs finger eating
for example after several hours of
flying Bengali phrases and the exchange
of warm smiles and joyful glances we
paid obeisance at his feet bid adieu
with a pronom and our departed from
Calcutta with an everlasting memory of a
sacred meeting greeting although I write
chiefly my external impressions of him
yet I always conscious of a true basis
of
as spiritual glory I felt his power and
shall carry that feeling as my divine
blessing from America Europe and
Palestine I had brought many presents
for sri dr. schwa he received them
smiling but without remark for my own
use I had bought in Germany a
combination umbrella cane in India I
decided to give the cane to master this
gift I appreciate indeed my gurus eyes
were turned on me with affection
understanding as he made the unwanted
comment from all the presence it was the
cane that he singled out to display to
visitors
Master please permit me to get a new
carpet for the sitting-room I had
noticed that Sri Yukteswar Tiger skin
was placed over a torn rug do so if it
pleases you my gurus voice was not
enthusiastic behold my Tiger mat is nice
and clean I am monarch in my own little
kingdom beyond it is a vast world
interested only in externals as he
uttered these words I felt the years
rolled back once again I am a young
disciple purified in the daily fires of
chastisement as soon as I could tear
myself away from Serampore and Calcutta
I set out with mr. right for an Qi what
a welcome there a veritable ovation
tears stood in my eyes as I embraced the
selfless teachers who had kept the
banners of the school flying during my
15 year absent the bright faces and
happy smiles of the residential and day
students were ample testimony to the
worth of their many cited school and
yoga training yet alas the ranch
institution was in dire financial
difficulties sermon Indra Chandra Nandi
the old Maharaja's chasm bar palace had
been converted into the central school
building and who had made many princely
donations was now dead many free
benevolent features the school when I
was seriously endangered for lack of
sufficient public support I had not
spent years in America without learning
some of its practical wisdom its
undaunted spirit before obstacles for
one week I remained in Ranchi wrestling
with critical
problems then came interviews in
Calcutta with prominent leaders and
educators a long talk with the young
maharaja of Kazon bar a financial appeal
to my father and lo the shaky
foundations of Ranchi began to be
righted many donations including one
huge check arrived in the nick of time
from my American students within a few
months after my arrival in India I had
the joy of seeing the raunchy school
legally incorporated my lifelong dream
of a permanently endowed yoga
educational center stood fulfilled that
vision had guided me in the humble
beginnings in 1917 with a group of seven
boys in the decade since 1935 Ranchi has
enlarged its scope far beyond the boys
school widespread humanitarian
activities and all carried on there in
the Shama Charen Lahiri mihashi mission
the school or yoga satsanga Brahma Chara
Vidyalaya conducts outdoor classes and
grammar and high school subjects the
residential students and days scholars
also receive vocational training some
kind the boys themselves regulate most
of their activities through autonomous
committees very early in my career as an
educator I discovered that boys who
impishly delight in outwitting a teacher
will cheerfully accept disciplinary
rules that are set up by their fellow
students never a model pupil myself I
have a ready sympathy for all boys
pranks and problems sports and games are
encouraged the fields resound with
hockey and football practice Ranchi
students often win the cup at
competitive events the outdoor gymnasium
is known far and wide muscle recharging
through will is the llegada
feature mental direction of life energy
to any part of the body the boys are
also taught asanas postures sward and
lasse stick play and jiu-jitsu the
Uganda health exhibitions at the Ranchi
vidyalaya have been attended by
thousands instruction and primary
subject is given in Hindi to the cold
tolls and mundos aboriginal tribe to the
province
classes for girls only have been
organized in nearby villages the unique
feature of Ranchi is the initiation to
Kriya yoga the boys daily practice their
spiritual exercise engage in gita
chanting and are taught by precepts an
example of virtues of simplicity
self-sacrifice honour and truth evil is
pointed out to them as being that which
produces misery good is those actions
which result in true happiness evil may
be compared to poison honey tempting but
laden with death overcoming restlessness
of body and mind by concentration
techniques has achieved astonishing
results it is no novelty at Ranchi to
see an appealing little figure age 9 or
10 years sitting for an hour or more and
unbroken poise the unwinking gaze
directed to the spiritual eye often the
picture of these Ranchi students has
returned to my mind as I observed
collisions over the world who hardly
able to sit still through one class
period raunchy lies 2,000 feet above sea
level the climate is mild and equitable
the 25 acres site by a large bathing
pond includes one of the finest orchards
in India 500 fruit tree mangoes guava
lychee jackfruit date the boys grow
their own vegetables and spin at their
own chakras a guest home is hospitably
open for Western visitors the raunchy
library contains numerous magazines and
about a thousand volumes in English in
Bengali donations from the West and the
East there is a collection of the
scriptures of the world a well
classified museum displays
archaeological geological and
anthropological exhibits trophies to a
great extent of my wanderings over the
Lord's varied earth the charitable
hospital and dispensary of allari
mihashi mission with many outdoor
branches and distant villages has
already ministered to 150,000 of India's
poor the Ranchi students are trained in
first aid and have given praiseworthy
service to their province at tragic
times of flood or famine
in the orchard stands a shiva temple
with a statue of the Blessed master
Larry Masha daily prayers and scripture
classes are held in the garden under the
mango Bowers branch high schools with
the residential and yoga features of
Ranchi had been opened and are now
flourishing they are the yoga satsangha
Vidyapeeth school for boys and lakshman
pour and be here at the you gotta
satsangha high school and hermitage at a
magic in Midnapore a stately yo gotta
mouth was dedicated in 1939 at Dakshin
waar directly on the ganges only a few
miles north of calcutta the new
hermitage affords a haven of peace for
city dwellers suitable accommodations
are available for Western guests and
particularly for those seekers who are
intensely dedicating their life to
spiritual realization the activities of
the yagota mouth include a fortnightly
mailing of self-realization fellowship
teachings to students in various parts
of India it is needless to say that all
these educational and humanitarian
activities have required the
self-sacrificing service and devotion of
many teachers and workers I do not list
their names here because they are so
numerous but in my heart such one has a
lustrous niche inspired by the ideals of
Larry mascha these teachers have
abandoned promising worldly goals to
serve humbly to give greatly mr. Wright
formed many fast friendships with Ranchi
boys clad in a simple dhoti he lived for
a while among them at Ranchi Calcutta
Serampore everywhere he went
my secretary who has a vivid gift of
description hauled out his travel diary
to record his adventures one evening I
asked him a question dick what is your
impression of India peace he said
thoughtfully though racial aura is peace
end of chapter
